column4: What program can I use to burn an ISO to a cdwriter (ubuntu ofcourse)
cdrecord
man cdrecord? or if you want to do it graphically, you can use k3b, gtoaster, xcdroast, etc.
ok, cdrecord -scanbus then ;)
you might want to do that as root.
try cdrecord dev=ATA -scanbus
hmm, same problem here :P
I think it's a problem with the latest cdrecord package.
yeah, I posted a bug about that a long time ago which got fixed. Seems it has returned :p
try scanning the bus with cdrdao then
i.e. sudo cdrdao scanbus
as root ofcourse.
well, err, i get this error http://pastebin.com/292937
hmm...
is this a dvd?
how large is it?
how large is the iso?
should work then...
hm, yea, should, i had a few troubles with this writer on Windows.
as i mentioned, i have had several issues with this CDWriter on Windows, and just tried a new box I got.... Not working in a nutshell.
I contacted HP support and they had no idea what was wrong, they just told me to check out settings on Windows... that didnt work ofcourse :\ I think the drive is screwed up totally.
try without -overburn ?
yeh, i added that originally and posted the log of that
but did you try *without* -overburn?
without -overburn returns a error that the media isnt big enough, sorry, i misread
oh, that indicates that the drive is not working properly. This was a 64M iso?
no, its a 614MB is :)
oh, right. Should work anyways. So my guess is that the drive is not reporting to the OS it is able to write anything at all.
yea.... :( unfortunatly, i have no idea how to fix this issue.
have you tried with another cd burner?
ok... but this *might* be a problem with cdrecord itself. Not sure.
hehe
doubt it, i had the same problems on windows with countless applications
oh, ok.
I guess you just have to buy a new one then :(
lol.. hm.. wonder if i can smash the  drive first
haha, just throw it out of the window.
if it was a hard-drive, you could make two speakers out of it ;)
oh, that's not good.
hehe
so you've never actually been able to write with it properly?
so you've never actually been able to write with it properly?
nope
not even in windows?
nope, no where
I guess you shouldn't break it then :P send it back and ask for a replacement.
its a old model
oh, too bad.
HP isn't giving out firmware upgrades for free!?
they used to, but lost money perhaps by giving fixes to their own crappy models that never worked!
heh
there are laws about that you know :P but not if your cd writer here is very old.
well, after 10 minutes of tinkering with the writer, i got it open
well, guess i wont be able to write a cd for a long time, LOL.. anyways, erm... maybe i should try distrobutions with floppy installs
oh, that's sad :p
yea, sad that hp wont give you a working product
did the writer work before?
nope, the writer never worked..
crossover office?
yea, that
yep, thought so.
this cdwriter will make a nice warm fire for me to warm upto tonight :)
it will!? I didn't know cd writers made good fire"wood"
if it cant, ill burn it anyways:P
hehe :P then send it to HP
maybe i should burn it, then put it in a baggy, and send it to them :P
with a note attached: "This drive is broken, please send a new one"
yeah, sounds like a good idea.
well, never buy another product from HP, that's for sure.
also, I've not had a plesant experience with asus cd writers.
you k onw, I tried a yamaha drive once, didnt work either :(
eh? :(
yea.. well, i didnt do anything in depth... only at default didnt work.. my dad has a cdwriter in his laptop, but very little he lets me write a cd
so you tried another cd writer on the same system as the HP, and it didn't work either?
err.. believe so
then it's probably not the cd writer..
which version of cdrecord?
the thing is, now I put it into my server box (atm it used to be on my desktop box) , and it wont work on my server OR desktop
but it used to work on your desktop? :p
hang on , i got my server apart.. let me rewire it
have you tried using another program such as cdrdao to write a cd? just for testing?
nope
try that perhaps. (cdrdao is for audio cds)
oh, this is the same driver?
I thought you said this was a different one :P
oh, phew :P
maybe my best bet is to use floppies :(
maybe try netinstall?
heh.. of what?
ubuntu? :p
they have netinstall via floppy?
not sure...
